fko.chessly.ui.JavaFX_GUI

Class JavaFX_GUI_Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • fko.chessly.ui.JavaFX_GUI.JavaFX_GUI_Controller
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Observer

    public class JavaFX_GUI_Controller
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Observer
    Main Controller for the Chessly JavaFX user interface. It actually builds the complete UI when initialize is called. It received all fields from the FXML file which were injected with values by the FXML loader. It takes care of all user input by defining actions which are called by the UI and which were declared in the FXML file. This controller is also defined as an observer to the model and receives all updates the model shares via notifyObservers(...). The update and updateFrom methods will then update the ui based on the changes in the model. It is important that the the update of the ui will happen via Platform.runLater() so they happen in the FX thread.
    Author:
    Frank

      • setPlayerMove

        public void setPlayerMove(GameMove move)
        This method is called from a mouse event from the user. It hands a move over to a known HumanPlayer and then nulls the reference to the HumanPlayer. To make a HumanPlayer known call setMoveReceiver(HumanPlayer). If no HumanPlayer is known to the object nothing happens
        Parameters:
        move -

      • setMoveReceiver

        public void setMoveReceiver(HumanPlayer player)
        Is called when a HumanPlayer has notified its Oberservers (UI) that it is waiting for a move from a human player. If the receiving player is know to the class it accepts new moves through setPlayerMove() usual from mouse input
        Parameters:
        player -

      • update

        public void update(java.util.Observable model,
                   java.lang.Object event)
        Is called whenever the model has changes. Needs to update the GUI accordingly. The update itself need to be done in the FX thread (FAT) so it will be called via Platfrom.runLater(). To make the caller wait for the ui to be updated before the method returns we can use PlatformUtil.platformRunAndWait(). This method is called whenever the observed object is changed. An application calls an Observable object's notifyObservers method to have all the object's observers notified of the change.
        Specified by:
        update in interface java.util.Observer
        Parameters:
        model - the observable object.
        event - an argument passed to the notifyObservers method.
        See Also:
        PlatformUtil.platformRunAndWait(Runnable)
